;On November 22, 2023, the official website of the Ministry of Education announced matters related to the 2024 National Master’s Degree Admissions Examination. According to statistics, the number of applicants for the national postgraduate examination in 2024 is 4.38 million, a decrease of 360,000 or about 7.6% from the 4.74 million applicants for the postgraduate examination in 2023. This is also the first time in eight years that the number of applicants for the postgraduate examination has increased compared with the previous year. fall back.

;

;Why has the number of postgraduate entrance examinations declined? The outside world has summarized some possible reasons: some graduates turned to the public entrance examination, striving to get an iron job in one step, and withdrew from the postgraduate entrance examination track; some graduates no longer regard the postgraduate entrance examination as a choice, thinking that it is just a matter of paper. A postgraduate diploma may not necessarily lead to a good job, so it is better to enter the job market in advance to save opportunity costs; the postgraduate recruitment policies of major universities have changed. "The number of places for professional masters has increased and the number of places for academic masters has decreased", which has reduced the cost-effectiveness of postgraduate studies, and some prices Sensitive candidates give up in the face of high tuition fees.

;

;It is not difficult to see that these reasons all stem from the rational choices of candidates as "economic people": studying has increasingly become an investment, and the consumption attribute of higher education is also strengthening. If the candidates believe that studying for graduate school cannot improve the competitiveness of the job market and cannot bring good economic returns in the future, then the candidates will rationally consider "whether studying for graduate school is worth it", thereby reducing the "supply" of the higher education market. There is a rumor going viral that a famous postgraduate entrance examination teacher successfully predicted the decline in the number of people taking the postgraduate entrance examination. In fact, this also shows that his "preaching" over the years has achieved certain results.

;

;From a statistical point of view, the change in candidates' attitudes has also taken several years, which is essentially a "reverse incentive" brought about by changes in the job market. Statistics on the number of applicants for postgraduate entrance examinations over the years show that this number declined in 2014 and 2015, but has shown an upward trend since 2015, reaching a peak in 2023. The year-on-year expansion of postgraduate enrollment and the increase in the number of graduates have made the job market supply unable to keep up with the employment demand of graduates. This imbalance in supply and demand has naturally been transmitted to the upstream higher education market.

;

;It should be admitted that in reality, only a small proportion of people go to graduate school to satisfy their personal enthusiasm for knowledge or for scientific research. Most students go to graduate school for employment, which can be subdivided. Further studies to postpone employment, and "gold-plated graduate school" for better employment. Unfortunately, both of these options are facing great challenges amid a weak job market. Of course, students are not fools and will also adjust their life strategies according to social reality.

;

;The key factors that affect the supply and demand of the job market are the economic cycle and industrial structure. The feedback from the job market also determines the cost-effectiveness of graduate school. None of the three parties, students, employers, or universities, can answer the question of “is graduate school worth it” alone? In the face of sluggish demand in the job market, both employers and candidates have begun to take action to answer this question: companies have reduced the scale of school recruitment, while candidates have seen a decline in the number of applicants. What is worth asking is, how will universities respond?

;

;Since this century, the number of postgraduate students enrolled in China has increased year by year, from 220,000 in 2003 to more than 1 million in 2020, and now accounts for about 10% of undergraduate graduates that year. Major universities have expanded their enrollment of master's degree students so rapidly over the years. On the one hand, they are of course adapting to the growing needs of the job market. On the other hand, they can also apply for more funds for themselves, charge more tuition fees, and improve various evaluation indicators. In short, it is to strive for more benefits.

;

;In addition to the "reverse incentives" in the job market, the sluggish fertility rate is destined to continue to reduce the number of postgraduate entrance examinations in the future, and the phenomenon of "the merger of primary and secondary schools" will sooner or later spread to higher education. field, this will be a more decisive factor in the future than "candidates choose not to take the exam". In other words, the decline in the number of people taking postgraduate entrance examinations is an irreversible trend. In the future, colleges and universities may face a new enrollment gap of one million levels every year and have to face the severe situation of "competition for existing students". This is a serious issue that colleges and universities need to deal with urgently. challenge.

;

;"Reducing enrollment for master's degrees and expanding enrollment for associate's master's degrees" and "extending the academic system for associate's and master's degrees" are the response plans that some colleges and universities have come up with. In this way, they can not only maintain the original enrollment scale, but also increase enrollment. Collect tuition fees. But the question is, when colleges and universities make a fuss about the academic system and quota of associate and master's degrees, can they really "ensure the quality of training and improve employment competitiveness", or can they just "charge one more year of tuition" or even "delay one year"? "Employment" itself is quite debatable and deserves reflection. Some candidates' doubts about the cost-effectiveness of master's degrees may be one of the reasons for the decrease in the number of postgraduate students this year.

;

;According to the principles of organizational behavior, "organizations will work hard to create jobs for themselves, and employees of organizations will work hard to create jobs for each other." Since an organization has been established, it will do everything possible to maintain its existence, especially The public sector eats up financial resources. Public universities have long relied on taxpayers' money to operate and do not need to directly face market competition. Naturally, they will find ways to maintain their existing graduate spots.

;

;However, changes in supply and demand in the job market and the impact of declining fertility rates will be transmitted sooner or later. The arrival of the enrollment gap has become an irreversible trend. The decline in the number of postgraduate entrance examinations this year is a timely warning to major universities. Comply with the needs of the job market, comprehensively consider social needs, adjust the recruitment plan for graduate students, and better serve the public.

;

;

;; (Picture from Honor 100 series Photography/picture);

;

;Sign of tragedy

;

;"Compared with before, have I changed in any way?" Zhang Xincheng asked. He was referring to the interview with Southern People Weekly in 2019, when he had just graduated from the Central Academy of Drama. In the past few years, his acting career had become more mature.

;

;Zhang Xincheng has appeared in more types of film and television works and discovered more diverse artistic skills, including participating in reality shows, releasing music albums, and expressing his thoughts more freely in interviews, showing a more relaxed attitude. On the one hand, "I used to think this was not good, that was not good, but now I feel more confident." But he still habitually looks at himself and cares about his external presentation, just like when he was watching a movie on set Playback in the viewfinder, scrolling through audience comments on social media.

;

;The radar of self-examination is always on. Zhang Xincheng will often make corrections or additions to a sentence after finishing it. "When making a movie, you will feel that you are dedicating yourself to art. ... The art here is a false proposition. It is not art in a broad sense, but the art you think you are. When you dedicate yourself to it, you will feel very ritualistic. "Every time the team we work with work hard, everyone is immersed in it, there are no bystanders. Of course, there will be a creator trap for insiders, and they may go to the other extreme, but the process is wonderful."

;

; Family education and schooling experience have shaped Zhang Xincheng’s serious and rigorous character. In middle school, he was taught to be a top student. "My mother always told me not to do anything inappropriate, so I stuck to the rules most of the time." After entering the Chinese Opera, he was taught to be a good actor. He will use an academic attitude to talk about performance, how to speak lines accurately and naturally, and how to design habitual actions to distinguish characters. His rationality and prudence even allow him to design the flaws of characters, because perfect people do not exist. .

;

;But Zhang Xincheng feels that he is not a very self-motivated person in nature. He is lazy and procrastinates. He is also not a person who uses rationality to choose the optimal solution. He is more willing to follow his inner thoughts of escape. After working, like all young people who are just beginning to try to be independent, he slowly freed himself from the shackles of previous disciplines and "opened up" himself through the profession of actor.

;

;Zhang Xincheng, who views himself "rationally", is more "emotional" in his choice of scripts. He still tends to choose tragic characters that he is more interested in, such as Cheng Yizhi in "The Light", who is born like Weed, who has been tortured, has seen all the darkness and filth in the world; Pei Zhi in "The Basics of Genius" has been making a choice between sacrificing for his family and pursuing himself.

;

;Zhang Xincheng has gained an ancient Greek tragic aesthetic in these characters, "Life itself is dull, but the life in the drama has ups and downs. There may be a car accident, and the life will be broken; there may be a meeting To the death of loved ones. But pain is directly proportional to happiness. During the filming process, the more pain and torture I experienced, the more happiness I felt in retrospect." In the unusual tragic experience, the perceptual switch was turned on. Open it, "I can feel the emotions of the world more and start to receive signals."

;

;Equal time

;

;It's like building blocks high and then knocking them all down again. From learning to be a Since he was an actor, Zhang Xincheng has been training himself to shape characters, designing and reviewing at the same time. When filming "Basic Method of Genius", he felt that these external formal things were "finished" and no longer needed to be done deliberately.

;

;“I suddenly noticed that when I say a line, I don’t just say it to rhythm and handle it well, but to put this sentence into the opponent’s heart. Every expression and line I make, It is stimulating the opponent. All the designs are not important. When you feel the emotion in your heart, you will naturally express it." When filming "Dark Fire", Zhang Xincheng acted in Mandarin with dialect color, and he no longer thought about how to act. He spoke his lines but didn't say a single word wrong.

;

;The process of building, tearing down and rebuilding was not peaceful and was accompanied by long periods of anxiety. Zhang Xincheng's debut went smoothly. He started taking roles while he was in school, and one crew followed another. But he felt that he did not have a particularly distinctive trait that made people remember him, and he could not find one for himself. "It seems difficult for me to do it." When participating in a reality show, he should have found a way to highlight himself, but he was still used to it. hide behind; follow your heart when choosing a script. When the results are not satisfactory, you will inevitably fall into self-doubt, "Am I not capable enough?"

;

;Until this year, Zhang Xincheng was able to say it calmly. , "I can't do this", and can accept all choices calmly, "I want to understand, time is equal, you didn't do that thing in those four months, but you did other things, you got It’s like opening a box, you can only choose one box, and you can’t see the contents of other boxes. You lose the other boxes, but you get this one.”

;

; After the sense of gain and loss and utilitarianism became less strong, looking back on the past, he finally changed his self-evaluation passing score to 90 points. "If life is lived for a result, it seems that time will become shorter. If the process is unfolded, , it seems that a lot of things have happened, just have fun in the process."

;

;Zhang Xincheng knows what the pinnacle of his career is: to become a highly reputable actor, not just for his excellent acting skills. , has commercial value, is respected by others, and is unique. He also missed the beginning of his career. At an age when he didn’t know what filming was, he had endless energy every day. After filming, he would play with the crew and take photos with costumes, props, and scene management. “I don’t think so. I was stupid at that time, and I thought it was quite valuable. It took a long time to receive education and change the habits of childhood, but it would be very difficult to finally return to the freedom of childhood."

;

;True The Paradox

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What adjectives would you use to describe yourself? ;

;

;;Zhang Xincheng: ;;Lazy, out-of-the-box thinking, and optimistic. I used to think that I was pessimistic, because I often saw things in a bad light, but I found that there might be a layer of optimism underneath the pessimism. After thinking about it, I still felt that things would definitely get better, and I still believed in some hope. Although I prefer tragedies, it is precisely because I have a relatively optimistic core that I like tragedies and dare to watch them. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What do you think is your most distinctive trait? , a trait that comes to mind when everyone mentions it, or do you think you have such a trait? ;

;

;;Zhang Xincheng: ;;I don’t think I have such a trait. Everyone knows that I usually play the roles I have played, but actually I don’t know either. What are your own personal characteristics. In this short video era, people are always required to have a very obvious label. But I feel like I'm not that kind of person. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;When you participate in a reality show, you will give Do you want to find a characteristic that you want to show to everyone? ;

;

;;Zhang Xincheng: ;;No, I participated in the variety show just to rest, not to highlight myself. I don’t speak much in it, and I don’t lead opinions. Everyone says you have to do this or that, stand out and let everyone remember you. I think that will put a lot of pressure on me. I am not a person who talks a lot at any time, so I don’t force myself to talk deliberately. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What do you think you are in the reality show? The real you? ;

;

;;Zhang Xincheng: ;;Reality shows have a very real part. Not everything is deliberately created, but people have many shortcomings. In real people, When I show off, I try my best to cover up these shortcomings and try my best to be the best version of myself. I feel that this is not the real me. ;

;

;It is different when you are acting, because you are not yourself, so you are very free. When we were children, we played a game called "Grand Theft Auto" in which we raced and shot. In reality, no one would do this because they are bound by morality, but in the game there is no such thing. It does not mean that everyone desires to do sinful things. It just means you are freest when you are not yourself. The role is played by you, and you do his things, but people don’t think you are him. You are not “you”, but you are “you”. Instead, reality shows must become a better “you”.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;You often share your life on social media, what do you like to shoot? What kind of photos? ;

;

;;Zhang Xincheng:;;According to my previous personality, I didn’t like to record. Why should we record? Can’t we just move forward? Now I will stop and take a few photos without knowing what I am taking, as if it is stored in the camera forever. I especially don't like to delete any record. So much memory is just for a certain moment in life, and I suddenly want to see it. I don't want this to get lost. It felt like I had seized the moment. ;

;

;I like to take black and white photos, high-contrast black and white, followed by photos with rich tones. It is a flaw that does not restore reality very well, but it is also a kind of beauty and has a sense of story. The sense of story is what attracts me, because there are so many good-looking things that make people dazzled and even attracted. But a photo with a story is rare in daily life and is relatively precious.

;On October 26, 2023, Congjiang Town, Guidong County, Hunan Province and Jiangxi Province At the Nanfengao Migratory Bird Protection Station at the junction of Yingpanwei Township, Suichuan County, bird rangers from the two provinces and two counties conduct joint bird protection inspections in the mountains ;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;Billions of migratory birds migrate across continents every year, and 3 of the 8 migration routes pass through China. In autumn, flocks of migratory birds take off from Siberia, the grasslands of Inner Mongolia, the North China Plain and other places, and fly to southern China via the east, middle and west routes to spend the winter. Hunan, Jiangxi and other places located in the central region have formed extremely narrow migration channels, which have become the "Millennium Bird Trail" that migratory birds migrating south from the central route must pass through.

;

;;

;

;On October 25, 2023, in Lanshan County, Hunan Province, road staff conducted routine bird protection inspections on vehicles entering the city; (Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;There are three migratory bird migration corridors in Hunan: Luoxiao Mountains, Xuefeng Mountains and Central Hunan Hills. More than 240 species of migratory birds fly from Siberia to Australia via Hunan every year. In the past, bird hunting was popular in some places along the bird trails. At the peak of migratory bird migration, some birds were always unable to reach their destinations because of this.

;

;;

;

;On October 25, 2023, staff were on duty at the Sihaiping Migratory Bird Protection Station in Yunbingshan, Lanshan County, Hunan Province;(Guo Liliang /Picture);

;

;;

;

;On October 24, 2023, at the forest farm in the old village of Daqingping Township, Lingling District, Yongzhou City, Hunan Province, inspectors were at the original bird hunting spot Conducting investigation ;(Guo Liliang/Picture);

;

;Huang Yongqiang, a member of the Hankou Migratory Bird Protection Station in Guidong County, said that in rainy and foggy days, migratory birds will come towards you. Fly where there is light. Bird catchers use bright lights or bonfires to attract birds, and set up a net in front of them, and the birds will "fall into the trap".

;

;;

;

;On October 25, 2023, at the Sihaiping Migratory Bird Protection Station in Yunbingshan, Lanshan County, Hunan Province, there is a migratory bird migration channel at the foot of the mountain in the distance. The station has increased bird protection equipment, facilities and supplies, strengthened patrols and alerts on duty, and severely cracked down on illegal and criminal activities of hunting migratory birds and other wild animals ;(Guo Liliang/Photo);;;

;In recent years, the Hunan Provincial Forestry Bureau has established 11 key counties for migratory birds throughout the province, including Yanling, Guidong, and Lanshan, and established dozens of protection stations throughout the entire migratory season. Implement 24-hour patrols. Yanling, Guidong and Suichuan County in Jiangxi Province formed a two-province and three-county "bird protection alliance". Some former bird hunters have also become bird protectors.

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 24, 2023, the municipal square of Lanshan County, Hunan Province, the street lights of some streets in the city and the landscape lights on the exterior walls of buildings were turned off to make way for migratory birds to make way for migratory birds to migrate at night. ;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;Party committees and governments at all levels in Hunan Province continue to strengthen actions to protect migratory birds and their habitats. While the bird protection campaign is being carried out, there are still people who are desperate enough to go up the mountain to hunt birds. Recently, the Lanshan County People's Court held a public hearing and pronounced a verdict in court on a criminal case of illegal hunting of migratory birds. Two villagers illegally hunted 58 migratory birds, all of which are terrestrial wild animals protected by the state and have important ecological, scientific and social values ​​(;i.e. " Three "wild animals") constituted the crime of illegal hunting and were sentenced to one year and three months and one year and two months respectively.

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 25, 2023, personnel on duty were patrolling around the Sihaiping Migratory Bird Protection Station in Yunbingshan, Lanshan County, Hunan Province;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;On October 16, 2023, the Hunan Provincial Forest Chief Working Committee Office issued the "Hunan Provincial Special Action Plan for Migratory Bird Protection" to carry out migratory bird protection across the province Special operations for major rectification, major protection, and major publicity were carried out, and centralized supervision work was carried out.

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 25, 2023, at the night duty point of the Sihaiping Migratory Bird Protection Station in Yunbingshan, forestry staff conducted inspections through infrared drones;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;The ecological wetland in the Dongting Lake area is an important "golden stop" on the migration channel of migratory birds. In recent years, with the return of forests to lakes and the removal of a large number of low fences and net fences, the ecology of the Dongting Lake wetland has been rapidly restored, and the number of migratory birds coming here to overwinter has continued to increase. From 2021 to 2022, the number of wintering waterbirds will reach 404,000, reaching a record high.

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 25, 2023, at the night duty point of the Yunbingshan Sihaiping Migratory Bird Protection Station, the personnel on duty analyzed and recorded the inspection situation;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;“We have been taking action to protect migratory birds! We are the first in the country to create provincial bird protection camps, county-level bird protection camps, migratory bird protection stations, and village-level bird protection camps. The team's four-level linkage model, the "Migratory Bird Guardian" action network has covered all cities and states in the province, with more than 5,000 local migratory bird guardians, in order to strengthen regular publicity, patrol and supervision operations, and jointly protect migratory birds passing through Hunan It has made a positive contribution to migration safety," said He Jianjun, executive vice president of the Hunan Provincial Ecological Protection Federation and general coordinator of the Hunan Provincial Bird Protection Camp.

;

;;

;

;On October 27, 2023, the Niutou Ao Migratory Bird Protection Station, located at the junction of Yanling County, Hunan Province and Jiangxi Province, is an important pass on the "Millennium Bird Trail";(Guo Liliang/Picture);

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 26, 2023, Heshuao Bird Protection Point, Qiaotou Township, Guidong County, Hunan Province, The bird protection team is on duty 24 hours a day at a former bird hunting spot ;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;;

;

;2023 10 On March 27, in Xiacun Township, Yanling County, Hunan Province, forestry staff and forest police inspected a "bird hunting hole" left many years ago ; (Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;;

;

;On the evening of October 31, 2023, volunteers discovered a newly installed bird net device in Nanmu Mountain, Ketou Township, Xinhua County, Hunan Province. Xinhua County Forestry Bureau, Forestry The public security and bird protection volunteers from the Hunan Provincial Ecological Protection Federation and the "Migratory Bird Guardian" action network immediately removed the bird nets ; (Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;;

;

;On the evening of November 18, 2023, volunteers were feeding the little swans in the Donggu Lake Wetland in Quyuan Management Area, Yueyang City, Hunan Province;( Guo Liliang/Picture);

;

;;;

;On November 2, 2023, in the Donggu Lake Wetland in Quyuan Management Area, Yueyang City, Hunan Province, volunteers picked up garbage and conducted full-time, All-round, full-coverage "escort" ;(Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;;

;

;In the early morning of October 25, 2023, In Nanshi Town, Lanshan County, Hunan Province, bird protection volunteer Tang Shengli photographed migratory birds by the reservoir. He photographed more than 120 kinds of migratory birds and compiled the "Blue Mountain Bird Map" to publicize bird protection knowledge to the masses ; (Guo Liliang/Photo);

;

;;

;

;On the evening of November 2, 2023, near the new house of the Liu family in Lutian Town, You County, Hunan Province, a group of herons flew with the sunset on their way; (Guo Liliang/Photo);

; Sun, 26 Nov 2023 14:25:03 +0800 新能源汽车充电费用为何上涨？http://www.infzm.com/contents/261338

;As one of the advantages of purchasing new energy vehicles, the cost of using new energy vehicles has always attracted the attention of car owners. . Recently, some new energy vehicle owners have reported that charging fees at public charging piles have increased since the second half of the year. Does this situation exist? With this question in mind, reporters conducted investigations in many places.

;

;Drivers of operating vehicles are more sensitive to changes in charging fees for new energy vehicles. Master Wei is an online ride-hailing driver in Zhengzhou, Henan, because he goes to public charging stations to charge once or twice a day. His mobile phone clearly records the cost of each charge.

;

;;

;

;Henan Zhengzhou Net Ride-hailing driver Wei Zhenhua: My charging fee has obviously increased. It used to be 1,200 yuan a month, but now it is as high as 1,500 yuan. It has indeed increased a lot. Especially after August, it rose by about 20 to 30%.

;

;The charging fee at public charging piles consists of two parts: electricity price and service fee. Electricity prices have been mainly formed by the market, with "level in and level out" and charging pile operators are not allowed to increase prices. Prices vary in different seasons and during peak, wave, and flat periods every day. The service fee is determined by each charging pile operating company based on market conditions. During the interview, the reporter found that charging fees at public piles have increased not only in Zhengzhou but also in many cities in Henan.

;

;;

;

;A new energy Co., Ltd. Henan regional director Yu Haitao: We charging companies have raised the service fee for primary charging. It has been raised by about 1 jiao to 1 jiao and 2 cents compared to the beginning of the year. So overall, everyone feels the increase in charging prices. The amplitude is relatively large.

;

;Surveys show that the service fees of some charging companies have even increased by about 50%. So, why do they want to adjust the price? Some charging pile operating companies told reporters that the high cost of early investment in charging pile construction and the long-term strategy of "grabbing the market" for low-price operations have put them under greater operating pressure.

;

;;

;

;An electronics company in Henan Wei Hongyu, Operations Director of Technology Co., Ltd.: The main reason for this increase is that as our operations deepen, we find that there is even a risk of inversion in the service fee income of charging stations compared to our station construction costs and our operating costs.

;

;Financial reports of some charging operation companies show that although the company's operating income is rising every year, it is negative profits every year. At the same time, in order to attract more users, operators tend to build high-power charging piles. However, the basic cost of high-power charging piles is relatively high. Some also need to build additional corresponding distribution boxes, and maintenance costs will naturally increase. . Therefore, raising service fees has become the current solution to recover costs.

;

;The cost of using new energy vehicles still has a greater advantage than that of gasoline vehicles

;

;Through interviews and surveys, the reporter found that in some cities, the cost of charging electric vehicles has indeed increased. So this situation Does it happen in all cities across the country? Are the cost advantages of buying an electric car still there?

;

;During interviews and surveys in many places, reporters found that the rise in charging costs for new energy vehicles only occurred in some cities, and charging costs in most cities across the country fell into a stable range.

;

;;

;

;Beijing New Energy Car owner: There is not much increase. I have charged at several nearby charging stations. There is not much change. It is basically the same as before.

;

;Shenzhen new energy vehicle owners: The electricity price at this time is 1.27 yuan per kilowatt hour. The overall cost is not particularly high and it is quite affordable.

;

;Data from the China Electric Vehicle Charging Infrastructure Promotion Alliance show that from January to October this year, the number of public charging piles in my country was 728,000, and the number in October was 63,000, a year-on-year increase of 50.3%. The increase in the number of charging piles not only meets the rapid development of new energy vehicles, but also makes competition among charging pile operating companies more intense.

;

;;

;

;A smart phone in Beijing Chen Dong, the person in charge of Technology Co., Ltd.: The overall charging price is still relatively low now, because the competition in the industry is fierce. We have more than 40 charging stations in Beijing. Winter is the peak charging season, and the overall cost has not been adjusted upwards. .

;

;Experts said that fluctuations in charging fees in most cities are the result of market supply and demand adjustments, and the quality of increases or decreases cannot be judged absolutely. Most cities have now abolished the maximum price limit on service fees, and each operator can determine the level of charging service fees based on market competition. At the same time, in the face of the issue raised by some netizens that the cost of using new energy vehicles is almost equal to that of gasoline vehicles, experts also gave reporters a calculation.

;

;;

;

;China Electric Power Corporation Liu Yongdong, deputy secretary-general of the federation: For example, for every 100 kilometers of our oil truck, the industry requires about 10 liters of oil. We estimate that it will be calculated at about 8 yuan, which is 80 yuan. Let's look at the tram again. On average, it requires about 15 kilowatt hours of electricity per 100 kilometers. The overall consumption of each kilowatt hour of electricity plus service fees is about 1.5 yuan. So the entire 15 kilowatt hours of electricity is about 22.5 yuan. Even if it is 25 yuan, we Comparing 25 yuan with 80 yuan, it should be said that there is still a huge gap.

;

; Various regions have launched new measures to shape the healthy development of new energy vehicles

;

; In order to ensure a good charging experience for new energy vehicle owners, various regions have successively introduced new policies such as time-of-use electricity prices for charging facilities. The implementation of relevant measures will not only guide car owners to use electricity rationally, but will also be more conducive to the healthy and sustainable development of the new energy vehicle industry.

;

;Experienced the transition from engineering to science (;Undergraduate survey technology and engineering, postgraduate geological engineering, doctoral geology

; span>;), Tang Limei decided to switch his research field to marine geology after listening to a lecture by chance while studying for his PhD. He realized early on that life has no limits and is full of unexpected and unplanned nodes.

;With ten years of accumulation in science popularization, she will bring a new book "Exploring the Deep Sea with the "Dragon"" at the end of 2023 to show people a new face of a science popularization writer. During the interview, she was wearing the team uniform she wore during the Antarctic scientific expedition in 2017, and it still fit her perfectly.

;

;Other than that, there are very few pastimes, and I hardly watch movies. Everything I do must "generate value and meaning." She would refuse without hesitation if asked to travel to the beach. Only when it became a matter of spending time with her children and family would she be willing to do so. "I can't go out to play by myself, but I'm willing to do it with others. It's valuable."

;

;She recalled more than ten years ago when life was not so full. , I still have plenty of time to watch "The Legend of Zhen Huan", and during the period when I went to the Pacific to "isolate", I watched it intermittently nearly 20 times in total. ;

;;

;The lecture content revolves around "Zhen Huan" "Scientific trivia in the Biography", "For example, there is an episode where the emperor went to An Lingrong's place to celebrate her birthday. ;"There is also braised pork, which is the Maillard reaction. Isn't the Maillard color popular this year? Maillard is actually caramel color, which is what it turns into after the sugar is burned. ;"There will be more and more of these industries, like my daughter, What can you say to make her feel happy? It’s not that her mother went to her school and gave a speech. ;

;The first book has not yet been released, and it is non-stop. Tang Limei has already begun to imagine her future "writing ambitions". "If I publish one book every year, I can probably write 20 more in my life. I hope one or two of them will be popular science classics for teenagers." Through these words again and again. and written words. What she is committed to disseminating is not only scientific knowledge, but also "the meaning of life." She hopes that her slightly tortuous but persevering experience can inspire young people and make those young faces in the audience understand, "Everyone should have their own way out and live well."

;

; "No problem"

;

; ; Southern Weekend: ; ; What kind of environment do you grow up? Is history a major you longed for from an early age? ;

;

; ; Lin Chaomin: ; ; I was born in Dali and grew up in Tengchong. In 1942, the Japanese occupied Tengchong. My parents fled to Dali. I was born there. After the Chinese Expeditionary Force recovered Tengchong in September 1944, we came back from Dali again. At that time, due to the Anti -Japanese War, Teng Chong had a rubble in the city, and there was almost no standing house in the city. The central elementary school we read is the temple. ;

; When I don't know what to do, I just know to read a good book. At that time, my mother subscribed to different magazines for our brothers and sisters every age. For example, when I was very young, I watched "Children", "Red Scarf", "Middle School Students" and "Juvenile Literature". There is a library. At that time, I read Lin Hansda's "New Zhou Story of the Eastern Zhou Dynasty", "New Editor of the Han Story", "The Story of the Three Kingdoms", "The Tai Shi who is not afraid of death", etc., and has a strong interest in history.

;

The motherland needs to be industrialized. You have to go to the study of engineering and work for modernization. My mother is a middle school teacher. In 1957, many liberal arts teachers were wronged by Tengchong No. 1 Middle School. My mother said that she could not learn arts and it was easy to make mistakes. Therefore, I always wanted to study science and engineering. Later, my mother also advocated that I was studying medicine because it was useful at any time. In high school, we were good in all subjects, but it was more prominent in liberal arts. ;

;

; In 1962, I was in high school. After graduating from the last semester, the school divided us into three groups according to our subjects. The other group is medical and agricultural department, and the other is liberal arts. My family decided to choose a science and engineering department, but in the specific division, I was assigned to the liberal arts group under the arrangement of the class teacher, Chinese teacher, and historical teacher. At that time, I went to Baoshan, Yunnan to take the college entrance examination, and issued a volunteer book before the exam. Everyone can fill in five volunteers, and I have filled the historical departments of Peking University, Renmin University of China, Nanjing University, Fudan and Yunda, and was later accepted to Yunda.

;

;

; At that time, he did not study well at the time. Since 1958, there have been more labor education in universities. At that time, the Ministry of Education stipulated that the student had to take a labor class in a school year, which was five weeks, and it could not exceed five weeks. But in fact, the labor of each school year is more than five weeks. At that time, there were three farms in Yunnan University, breeding rice, buds, wheat, vegetables, and Apple Parks, pig farms. In addition, there are many public welfare labor, such as planting trees on the mountain. When farmers are busy, they support the spring plowing and autumn harvest. Later, Kunming repairing the train station and calling us to help. By 1961, after investigating the Ministry of Higher Education, I felt that students had to do labor and go to school. In less than 4 years, they were less than much to learn. .

;

I first met him for the first time, but because he was a Lijiang, the Naxi people, the accent was very heavy, and he didn't understand much. ;

;

; But I was impressed after reading the article. In September 1966, I was studying in the senior year because the "Cultural Revolution" stopped class. ; ; Southern Weekend: ; ; I noticed in recent years Come on you to mention the unified history on many occasions. Is this from Mr. Fang's inheritance? ;

; In 1963, Mr. Fang published "On the Platerality of Chinese History Development" and began to talk about the overallness of Chinese historical development. ;

;In mid-May 2023, after nearly 10 hours of arduous climbing, Changsha girl Xu Zhuoyuan successfully climbed to the summit of Mount Everest. Four years ago, she once shouted "I want to climb Mount Everest" on a variety show. Four years later, at the age of 16, she fulfilled her promise with practical actions and became the youngest person in China to climb Mount Everest from the south slope.

;

;Influenced by her father, Xu Zhuoyuan started climbing when she was very young. When she was 4 years old, her parents took her to climb Mount Siguniang and unexpectedly found that she adapted well to altitude sickness. When she was 12 years old, she traveled to Tibet with her father Xu Jianglei. At that time, she regretted not being able to see the sunrise on Mount Everest due to weather conditions. On the way back, she climbed the peak of Mount Siguniang with her father. “It was my first time to climb a snow-capped mountain in a real sense.” From then on, she buried her desire to climb Mount Everest.

;

;Mountain climbing is an extreme sport that relies on luck. Since she got into climbing, her mood has become more stable. "People often die during climbing. Now for me, life and death are no big deal."

; < p>;This climb six months ago was Xu Zhuoyuan’s first challenge on Mount Everest. Before setting off, she packed her father Xu Jianglei's gloves when he climbed Mount Everest into his backpack, hoping to keep them as "a kind of inheritance." In 2007, Xu Jianglei climbed to the summit of Mount Everest, becoming the first person in Hunan Province to summit Mount Everest.

;

;Xu Zhuoyuan remembered that when she was approaching the summit, the Sherpa guide beside her reminded her that she was almost at the top and it was still dark. "The only thought in my mind was that I must see the top of Mount Everest." At sunrise on the mountain, my father’s summit photo has always impressed me. In the photo, he is high-spirited and smiling brightly facing the sun. I can feel his love for the snow-capped mountains. That photo is still displayed in my home. ." Fortunately, the sun came out almost at the moment she reached the top. Now, next to a picture of her father, there is a picture of her reaching the summit, with the rising sun behind her.

;

;"I want to climb Mount Everest"

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;When you were 12 years old, you said "I want to climb Mount Everest" on a show. What did you think at the time? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;; Ever since I was a child, Mount Everest has always had a different meaning to me. The summer after I graduated from primary school when I was 12 years old, my father took me to Tibet, but I didn’t see the Rizhao Jinshan Mountain due to the weather. Later, my father and I went to climb the peak of Siguniang Mountain together. This was my first time to truly climb a snow-capped mountain. It snowed on the mountain at that time. As a southerner, I found it very novel. From then on, I very much hoped to have the opportunity to climb Mount Everest to watch the sunrise. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;After setting that goal at the age of 12, my father How to say? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;He was quite shocked at the time. He didn’t expect that I would have this idea, and he probably thought that I wouldn’t really take action. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Did you set a deadline for yourself at that time? ? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;What I wanted at that time was to complete it as soon as possible. Since it was something I wanted to do when I was a teenager, if I waited until I was in my twenties or thirties to do it, my mood might be different. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Since then, you have started to work for the four Are you preparing to climb Mount Everest in the next year? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;I started to do some training from then on, but in the past few years, due to my studies, the training schedule was not so full. It wasn’t until I completed the climb of Muztagh Peak last year and got the ticket to Mount Everest that I started systematic training. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;In addition to training with 22 kilograms of sandbags every day, you What preparations have you made for climbing Mount Everest? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan: ;;For example, Bulgarian squats and rock climbing. My training emphasizes leg muscle and core strength training, as well as endurance, physical fitness and cardiorespiratory training. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Will intensive training affect your studies? ? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;Many people like to ask me how to balance studies and climbing. It is indeed difficult to balance them, but if you really love it, you will try your best. All ways to balance. My current high school coursework is very heavy, and my mountaineering training is also very heavy, so I will fill up all my free time and study ahead of schedule. ;

;

;Climbing to the top is not success, returning home is

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;How did you feel when you climbed to the top of Mount Everest? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;I thought I would be very excited. Climbing to the top would be regarded as fulfilling my dream of the past four years, but I didn’t know it was because the weather was too bad at that time. Cold and high altitude can compress some of people's emotions, but I'm actually quite calm. I remember taking out the flags in my bag one by one, taking pictures, and then calling my mother to report that everything was safe. Because the weather was so bad and there was a heavy snowstorm, the Sherpa guide urged me to retreat quickly, so I thought about retreating quickly. At that time, my parents suggested that I stay at Camp 2 for one more day and take a helicopter back to Everest Base Camp the next day. But I stayed on the mountain for 8 days. I didn’t take a shower or have an Internet connection for 8 days. This actually reached the limit for me. I threw my sleeping bag and moisture-proof mat directly to Camp 4 and decided to return to the base camp that day. , so it took me 22 hours to withdraw that day. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;In addition to not being able to take a shower, as a girl, you What difficulties did you encounter during the climb? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;In fact, women have more inconveniences when climbing than men, such as washing and going to the toilet. But both men and women are equal in front of the mountain, but women have to work harder to achieve this goal. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;In the 8 days without the Internet, you have nothing but What are you doing for training? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan: ;; Mainly training. We adapted to Camp 2 for 3 days, and then we were waiting for news from Camp 3 to see the road construction team. Can it be cultivated to the top? We were very lucky. If the road construction team had not repaired it at that time, we might have to withdraw to the Everest base camp and wait for the next cycle. The rest of the time, I would chat with my teammates on the mountaineering team, play cards, and fight against altitude sickness. I vomited violently the night I first arrived at Everest Base Camp. I don’t know if it was because I was not used to the climate in Nepal, so I rested for about two days before recovering. Later, I was training alone with my teammates at the base camp. My mother called me and advised me to withdraw. So this is also my first time to climb a mountain without my parents. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Didn’t you think about withdrawing it at that time? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan: ;;Maybe I am a bit stubborn, thinking that I have suffered so much and have to climb so many snow-capped mountains in one day before climbing Mount Everest. I've been training all night and finally got here, why not keep at it? ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;That call you made to your mother at the top of the mountain What was said on the phone? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;I said that I had reached the summit and told her not to worry, I would descend as soon as possible. My mother has always been reluctant to allow me to climb mountains because it is a very dangerous extreme sport. She had been worried. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What did mom say back? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;She told me that climbing to the summit is not success, but returning home is, and asked me to pay attention to safety. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Why do you still insist on climbing when it is so dangerous? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;Mountain climber George Mallory is often asked why he climbed Mount Everest. He always answers, "Because the mountain is the mountain." over there". We are lucky enough to be able to climb out of love, but climbing to the top is not only for me to let the world see me, I hope everyone can also see our new generation of Chinese youth. ;

;

;One cannot stay at the moment of climbing to the top forever

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;After climbing Mount Everest and returning to school, will your friends and classmates be curious about your experience? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;They would ask me what the scenery was like on the mountain. But I didn't feel much change. Everyone attends classes as usual, and I also attend classes and train step by step. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What impact does reaching the summit have on your current life? Influence? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan: ;;Actually, it’s nothing. One cannot stay at the moment of climbing to the top forever, and I also feel that I should not be too indulged in the joy of climbing to the top of a mountain. There will be countless mountain peaks in the rest of my life, whether in a physical sense or in other dimensions. My next goal is Kilimanjaro and I will start training again soon. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;But you will because you already have a good Are you more stressed because of your performance? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan: ;;Actually, it’s not bad. Every mountain has its own characteristics, and there are good and bad luck. For me, the important thing is to have the courage to try. I'll do a lot of preparation to get it done, and if it doesn't work this time, then next time. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;After reaching the summit, you will receive the Nepalese national The Tourism Bureau’s congratulatory message was certified by CCTV as “the youngest female athlete in China to climb the summit from the south slope”. Many people think this is a perfect life, what do you think? ;

;

;;Xu Zhuoyuan:;;It is a very satisfying thing to determine your dream and fight for it. For me, climbing Mount Everest is just a satisfactory answer at this stage. I am only sixteen or seventeen years old. The road ahead is long and there are still many papers to hand in. Mount Everest is just a way point. My goal in the next stage is to complete the 7+2 plan (the highest peaks of the seven continents plus hiking at the North and South Poles). At the end of this year, I will complete the climb of Mount Kilimanjaro in Africa with my mother. This is the first step of my 7+2 plan. ;

;

;Out of curiosity about the three bizarre murders and the murderer’s motives, Wei Shujun read the novel “The Mistake by the River” several times, but still didn’t understand. Feeling humiliated and excited at the same time, he opened the first page of the computer document and read "Mistake by the River" in enlarged font size. Below it were two lines of small characters, original work: Yu Hua, director: Wei Shujun.

;

;He wants to adapt this novella published in 1988. The perpetrators of the three murders all pointed to madmen, but they could not build a complete chain of evidence to bring him to justice, which made both the town and the criminal police captain Ma Zhe uneasy. Writer Yu Hua's parody of detective novels in the avant-garde literature period used violent absurdity as the surface and subversion of tradition as the core. I have sold the copyright several times but have never changed it.

;

;The difficult thing is to find a word that points to the philosophy behind all suspenseful stories. In 2021, Wei Shujun and screenwriter Kang Chunlei entered the second year of their adaptation. After overturning the general direction twice, they were determined to find the word. They searched for two days and two nights, wandering around the house until they got something.

;

; "Bug." He was quite satisfied with this new development. "It is a word born from the progress of information technology. It is a vulnerability problem based on code and the best rational logic. We think it is too accurate. , isn't our "Yong'an Town Story Collection" called 'Ripples of Life', this one is called 'Bugs of Life'."

;

;It was August 2021, and Wei Shujun was preparing to shoot a new film in Northeast China "White Crane Spreads Wings". After work, the crew plays badminton together. However, indoor venues have been closed due to the new crown epidemic, and they are planning to play basketball outdoors instead.

;

;A month ago, his second feature film "The Story of Yong'an Town" was selected for the Directors' Fortnight section of the Cannes Film Festival; a year ago, his first feature film "Wild Horse Parting Mane" was nominated for the Cannes Newcomer Award. As a feature film director, his graduate work "Yanbian Boy" won the Cannes Short Film Special Mention Award. He received critical acclaim when he first appeared on the scene. Industry seniors and critics praised his talents and talents, and were curious about the possibilities he brought to the table. sex. Wei Shujun received attention as a result.

;

;However, the adaptation of "The Mistake by the River" quickly fell into another strange circle. Bugs do not exist alone. To describe rational loopholes and loss of control, the premise is to explain what rationality is. The argument about rationality is a wide-ranging, academic discussion that is energy-consuming and unnecessary. "We looked in the wrong direction again," we had to give up.

;

;By chance, while scouting locations in Hangzhou, Wei Shujun felt that there should be a dream at the end of the story. "The causes of their deaths are not completely connected on a rational level and cannot serve to solve the case. But in the dream, they interlock with each other, as if they are all established, revealing a certain inevitability in a series of accidents, giving people a creepy feeling." In the final version of the script, dreams became the core sequence.

;

;This seems to be his consistent creative approach, which values ​​the true feelings of the creative subject and expresses them effectively in the film. Photography director Cheng Ma, who has worked with him three times, provided evidence: "We basically create based on our feelings."

;

;Cheng Ma and Wei Shujun met for the first time in Shanghai three years ago, and they chatted quite well. . They have many consensuses on the nature and creative concepts of movies, two of which are simple but very important: movies were created to create "realistic illusions" at the beginning, and they should still be so today, and movies may not be the best way to tell stories. It is a medium, but it is a channel for storing and transmitting the creator’s feelings.

;

;For example, regarding "The Mistake by the River", Wei Shujun told Cheng Ma that it was restrained, quiet, and elegant, and that many things happened on a humid and rainy day. This was how he felt when reading the novel. Accordingly, Cheng Ma felt that the images should be consistent with the 1990s, when the characters were wandering and out of place, and geographical features such as counties or towns were far away, not close. Cheng Ma suggested shooting on 16mm film, and they hit it off immediately.

;

;In November 2022, with 45 days left before filming, the crew arrived in Nanfeng, Jiangxi Province, where the filming took place, to make preparations. The actors were busy with their own work. Tong Linkai had to practice splits and back fists. Zhu Yilong wore a leather jacket to visit the local police and gained 30 pounds to achieve an overworked figure. Zeng Meihuizi was also making herself gain weight in order to look like a pregnant woman. The crew cooked together, watched movies, and played badminton.

;

;“I think the best state of creation is when all the main creators are relaxed. I don’t like that kind of tense, night-and-night (state) like a repair project, which is very tiring. That is to say, although it is You are working, but you still have your own life order, and you still retain your pursuit of beauty and passion for life." Wei Shujun said.

;

;He often carries a film camera with him - the crew has a total of more than 20 film cameras, and even a darkroom for developing black and white photos - to capture the daily life of the crew. There are more saved in his mobile phone photo album. When he opens it and looks through it, he sees friends meeting, travel scenes, rivers, trees, and the sea. “It seems to have some kind of ability to preserve time, making you think of it as a pleasant time.” In the afternoon, a happy state."

;

;Relaxation is rare. What is also rare is that, in Cheng Ma's words, Wei Shujun places a particularly high importance on creation. "As a director of his age, he can actually withstand a lot of pressure. We have to shoot smoothly, but many people ask us what to do with the scenes and what to do with the actors' time. For example, a certain role has many scenes, but the actors can only come for 10 days in total. , the usual approach of the crew is to focus on filming all his scenes in these 10 days. But Wei Shujun feels that smooth filming is of great value to his creation, so he will give up scenes that cannot be matched by actors or at inappropriate times."

;

;Kang Chunlei also said: "I think he has an almost intuitive ability to control the scene. I always told him, you shine on the scene."

;

;Also Once, Wei Shujun changed his character's name on the spot. In the novel, Ma Zhe's subordinate is Xiao Li, a young man who takes the initiative to report case analysis from time to time. So of course Tong Linkai’s name is Xiao Li. After a few days of filming, Wei Shujun suddenly said, thank you so much ; ("Thanks" means shit);, don't call me Xiao Li. Just call me Xiao Xie. Wei Shujun greeted other actors and revised his lines. The printed police officer ID card of Xiao Li was re-attached. Tong Linkai's role became Xiao Xie.

;

;But to be honest, the feeling at the scene was not that wonderful. Wei Shujun's own version is: "Imagine that when you were in school, you had to sit in the classroom at 7 a.m. every morning to study early. On the way from home after breakfast, you felt that you were still waking up. When you got to class, you thought about writing yesterday's homework. No, I didn’t write it, so I wrote it quickly. After I wrote it, I felt very at ease. I started to think about going to the canteen to buy something to eat during recess, and then I went to the actual class to listen to the teacher. It was the same on the set, everyone was here, Shui After brewing it, we started drinking water. We walked around the scene and the actors were almost done. Then we discussed the scene and confirmed our schedule with the photographer. Everyone prepared individually and then started to prepare for shooting. If something didn’t feel right in the first two days, Adjust it, and it feels good. If you take a few more shots, it will be time for lunch. It really feels like this."

;

;"There is a slope every day, and you have to climb up a slope. You have to crawl over to get to that position."

;

;"The Mistake by the River" was completed accurately and efficiently, and was shortlisted for the "Un Certain Regard" section of the Cannes Film Festival. Five months later, it won two honors: Best Film and Cinephile Choice at the Pingyao International Film Festival. After another four days, it was released nationwide.

;

;At the end of the film, there was often chatter in the theater. Wei Shujun used a long dream to allow Ma Zhe to reveal himself in order to resolve his own uneasiness and chaos. The dream was clear, coherent but illogical. After witnessing everyone's death by the river, Ma Zhe sat on an old cinema seat and saw the director on the big screen holding a ping pong ball with the number 3 printed on it, shouting at him. ——Ma Zhe! Third class merit! In this shot where conjecture and prophecy overlap, thousands of ping pong balls roll down from the bottom of the screen and swarm towards Ma Zhe.

;

;Everyone was very excited during the shooting. After taking one shot, everyone picked up the thousands of ping pong balls while shouting "One more, another one".

;

;At the end of the show, the audience was full of doubts and endless interpretations and comments about the film, forming multiple dreams outside the screen, a kind of "rationality and irrationality, the combination of the viewer and the viewer." effect". From this perspective, Wei Shujun's initial uneasiness when reading the novel, his exploration of the creator's intentions, and his several elusive moments during the adaptation were all conveyed to the audience. We think we have the answer, but in fact we have the illusion of an answer.

;

;"I am not too obsessed with pursuing the truth in life, because I feel that it is difficult to find it." Cheng Ma said that this is another consensus between him and Wei Shujun that the truth is difficult to find, "the so-called The fate of your life is a random existence. You can only see its existence and don’t know the truth behind it."

;

;The slight existentialist tendency of "The Mistake by the River" is just that Back to "existence precedes essence", or in other words, "back to the thing itself". Just reiterate one point, "I believe that I ;(creator); has determined the sole right of interpretation, and the audience must accept this interpretation Right, this is the biggest paradox."

;

;After the movie was released, Wei Shujun sent a message to Yu Hua, saying that it seems that we did not use a movie to write annotations for the novel, but used the movie to write an annotation for the novel. After reading. For a while, the two of them were keen to share with each other the audience's various interpretations of the movie, including a test paper on "Who understands the movie "The Mistake by the River" better, Yu Hua or me?" After Yu Hua finished, he showed Wei Shujun his score, which totaled 40 points.

;;In 1923, young Walt ·Disney came to Los Angeles and joined his brother Roy Disney. The two brothers jointly founded "Disney Brothers Studio". ;

;

;;Five years later, an animated character named Mickey;; (Mickey);; was born, with round ears, a pointed mouth, and a body Wear white shorts and be adventurous. No one expected that this Mickey Mouse would quickly become a hit and become a classic of the times. ;

;

;;

;

;;It can be said that everything Disney owned later was started by this Mickey Mouse. ;;After that, ;;Donald Duck, Snow White;;, The Lion King, Pinocchio;;Cao and others came out of here. series of IPs, and has expanded from animation to movies, streaming media, theme parks, games and many other fields, growing into a veritable global media giant. ;;;

;

;;This year is Disney;’s 100th anniversary. To commemorate this moment, it has launched a new animated feature film "Star Wish" 》.

;

;;;

;;Disney is a dream maker; factory, and most of its animated stories encourage people to bravely pursue their dreams. As a tribute to the centenary, "Star Wish" certainly closely follows this theme.

;

;The background of the movie is set in a kingdom of wishes called Rosas. People come from all directions to offer their dreams to the magical King Manifico, and the king will choose the right person from them. Help them achieve it.

;

;The heroine Yasha’s biggest wish is that her grandfather’s dream comes true. However, when she came into contact with King Manifico, she realized that ; the king was not as kind and generous as he appeared on the surface. ;

;

;;

;

;;Manifico is an extreme conservative. He will only select dreams that he considers harmless to realize, while shelving creative dreams. He regarded such dreams as a scourge that would shake Rosas's foundations. ;

;

;;Of course Asha disagrees with the king's point of view, so she joins forces with the wishing star and Valentino the goat to try to get her grandfather's dream back. The king, under the temptation of lust for power, further darkened. ;

;

;;

;

;;The assists in the movie, the wishing star and the goat, are easily reminiscent of the combination of Olaf and the reindeer in "Frozen". ;;In fact, "Wish" did use the production team of "Frozen", directed by Chris Buck;; ("Frozen"); ;Co-directed with Fawn Villasensohn;;("Dragon");;; Jennifer Lee;;("Crazy") Zootopia", "Wreck-It Ralph", "Frozen");;, Allison Moore, Chris Buck;;("Frozen"); ; Co-screenwriter; Liu Yifei and "Feng Shen" star Yu Shi voice the heroine Asha and the goat Valentino respectively. ;

;

;;

;

;;

;

;;In the past, Disney always promoted the truth, goodness and beauty in the world, but "Star Wish" used a lot of space to depict the process of the king's ambition expanding and eventually being backlashed. And ;;No matter what the situation, Asha was always loyal to her heart, ; and won more allies, and finally overthrew Manifico's rule. The dystopian nature of the movie is very un-Disney.

;

;"I don't agree with your point of view, but I will defend to the death your right to speak." Putting it here is an excellent comment. Everyone has the right to pursue their dreams, and the king cannot deny it easily.

;

;In addition to being good at creating dreams, Disney is also good at creating princesses. Since the release of Snow White (Disney's first animated feature film "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs") in 1937, Disney has followed the development of the times for more than 80 years and successively launched more than a dozen characters. Princess. ;

;

;;

;

;;Early; Disney princesses, beautiful and innocent, with love first: Snow White who ate the poison apple waited for the prince to kiss them to wake them up; Cinderella who dropped her crystal slipper ( "Cinderella," 1950) relies on the prince to rescue her; the cursed Princess Aurora ("Sleeping Beauty," 1959) also wants a kiss from the prince's true love.

;

;It can be said that the princesses of this period satisfied people's beautiful imagination of love, but they were too dependent on men, had beauty but no brains, and were always in a passive ; situation waiting for the prince to save them. ;

;

;;

;

;;Especially the box office failure of "Sleeping Beauty";; made Disney; start to reflect. Later princesses have improved their initiative and self-awareness. For example, Ariel in "The Little Mermaid" (1989) sacrifices singing to walk on land in order to meet the man she loves; Ariel in "Beauty and the Beast" (1991) Belle and the ugly beast have been in love for a long time; Jasmine in "Aladdin" (1992) ;; refuses the king's offer Referring to marriage, falling in love with Aladdin. ;

;

;;;;The princesses of this period;; will take the initiative to fight for what they want, but;; Their goal in life is still to find true love. ;

;

;;

;

;;Such "progress" was obviously not enough. Later, Disney; began to give princesses a brave and rebellious spirit. They were no longer powerless cowards. Miss ;, and ;; is both wisdom and strength. For example;;For example, in "Mulan";;(1998);;Hua Mulan disguises herself as a man;; and goes into battle to kill the enemy;;; span>;;"Tangled";; (2010);; Rapunzel;; dares to knock over a stranger with a pan; "Brave" Merida in "Legend" ;; (2012) ;; is like a naughty baby who ruined her own blind date with her own hands. ;

;

;;

;

;;The emergence of "Frozen";; (2013);; directly broke the "prince and princess living happily together" "The main purpose. The family relationship between the two sisters became the main thread, and the handsome prince became the villain of the entire film. The princess no longer passively waits for the prince to save her, the princess herself is very powerful; true love no longer involves the prince kissing the princess, and the sisterhood is also very touching. ;

;

;;

;

;;It can be said that Disney subverted Disney. Starting from this;movie, Disney princesses completely got rid of the male gaze. They took off their costumes and became their own heroes. Like the ; princesses in "Moana" (2016) and "Legend of the Dragon" (2021), they all gave up on romance. One lived her life how she wanted, and the other led her people to protect their home and country. . ;

;

;;

;

;;And this "Star Wish";; is also of the same origin;. Asha dares to question and is not afraid of power. In order to protect all the residents of Rosas He did not hesitate to stand on the opposite side of King Manifico.

;

;But compared with the previous princesses, Asha's combat effectiveness is obviously weakened. She no longer has the ability to go to heaven and earth. She is more like an ordinary person, a civilian hero who resists the aloof king. Just like the theme song of the movie sings, "Maybe you are afraid but you still reach out your hand, and you will not run away because of a weak tremor."

;

;;This may also be the century-old road that Disney has walked for itself. Write down ;;’s sincere notes;;: ;;If you don’t forget your original intention and hold your dreams in mind, you can always get through the twists and turns of the river;; . ;
